meanings.definition: A device used to introduce a liquid or gas into a system.
meanings.sent1: The injector helped deliver fuel into the engine.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used the injector to add oil to the car.
meanings.sent3: The injector was like a tiny pump for the machine's heart.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an injector of hope into his despairing heart.
meanings.sent5: The injector hummed as it filled the system with life-giving fluid.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that injects something.
meanings.sent1: The nurse was the injector of the vaccine.
meanings.sent2: The bee acted as an injector of venom into the skin.
meanings.sent3: The injector of jokes at the party kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His smile was an injector of joy into her day.
meanings.sent5: The injector of ideas sparked creativity in the team.

meanings.definition: A medical device used to administer a drug or other substance into the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used the injector to give the patient a shot.
meanings.sent2: The nurse prepared the injector for the insulin injection.
meanings.sent3: The injector at the hospital was like a superhero with a needle.
meanings.sent4: Her words were an emotional injector, affecting his mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The injector hissed softly as it delivered the medicine into the arm.
